plants.name: Caladium
plants.description: The Monstera Deliciosa plant, also known as the 'cheese plant,' boasts large, glossy leaves with unique splits and holes, adding a touch of tropical elegance to ...

description.info:
The Monstera Deliciosa, commonly known as the Swiss Cheese Plant, is a popular tropical houseplant prized for its stunning, large, heart-shaped leaves that develop unique perforations or 'fenestrations' as they mature. Native to the rainforests of Central and South America, this evergreen climber can grow up to 10-15 feet indoors with proper care, though it's often kept smaller in pots. Its glossy, dark green leaves, which can reach up to 3 feet wide in ideal conditions, create a bold, exotic aesthetic, making it a favorite for interior decor and web design visuals. The plant's name, 'Monstera,' derives from the Latin word for 'monstrous,' referring to its impressive size, while 'Deliciosa' hints at its edible fruit, which tastes like a mix of pineapple and banana but is rarely produced indoors.

Care Requirements:
  • Light: Thrives in bright, indirect light but tolerates low light (though growth may slow).
  • Water: Water when the top 1-2 inches of soil feel dry; avoid overwatering to prevent root rot.
  • Soil: Prefers well-draining, peat-based potting mix.
  • Humidity: Loves high humidity (50%+), but adapts to average household levels.
  • Temperature: Best between 65-85°F (18-29°C); avoid cold drafts.
  • Support: As a climber, it benefits from a moss pole or trellis for vertical growth.

info.description: Medium  (12-14 inches )
Moderate (Once every 2-3 days. Keep soil slightly moist, not soggy)
Indirect Sunlight (Thrives in bright, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight-it can burn the leaves)
Easy (Great for beginners! Low-maintenance and resilient to occasional neglect)
Moderate (Moderate growth rate indoor)
No (Toxic to cats and dogs if ingested. Keep out of reach of pets)

review.name: John Watson
review.review2: Loved the Plant. Definitely worth it for Plant lovers!

needhelp.name: Just Bought a Plant?
needhelp.info:
Nice! Your seeds are in. Now let’s make sure they sprout strong.
Watering Tips: Keep soil moist but not soaked. Use a spray bottle twice a day.
Sunlight Needs: Place near indirect sunlight for 5-6 hours daily.
Soil Check: Use soft, well-drained soil. Mix with coco peat for best results.
